AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: The ATLAS chat transcript includes generic/boilerplate content that does not appear tailored to the user’s stated problem (license activation / device add failure). While it did successfully route to L1, the initial automated messaging looks noisy and potentially confusing rather than problem-focused.
evidence: “❗ IMPORTANT NOTICE ❗ … White-labeled versions of StreetSmart will no longer function after this date. ✅ If the version you're using is called StreetSmart, no action is needed.”
“For now, I am unable to take any file uploads…”
“--- Ticket generated by StreetSmart AI chat ---”

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: There’s no indication the customer was trapped in an AI loop or requested a human and couldn’t reach one. The issue moved quickly into human-agent handling with multiple agent responses.
evidence: “Action: l1”
Multiple public replies from named agents (e.g., Shaquille, Alexandr, Raymond) indicate human handling.

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: Support initially referenced an opportunity link from the ticket intake, but the requester later had to correct it, suggesting earlier work may have been anchored to the wrong record. Later, one agent advised cache/cookies clearing, while an internal note indicates the root cause likely wasn’t cache-related (mapping/case-sensitivity), which can reflect insufficient use of already-available internal context.
evidence: Agent message referencing: “...Salesforce instance [https://trilogy-sales.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Opportunity/0062x000008o1lQAAQ/view] not being set.”
Customer correction: “This is the correct Salesforce opportunity: https://trilogy-sales.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Opportunity/006Ih000004fwJXIAY/view”
Public troubleshooting: “Could you please ask the user to clear cache and cookies, restart the browser and relogin…”
Internal note: “No kind of refresh is needed after updating the gsheet. There is no caching for the gsheet anywhere.”

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: The ticket shows an overall long lifecycle (about two weeks from creation to close) and multiple explicit “on hold” periods, which are meaningful delays even if individual replies were sometimes prompt. The structured CSV also indicates a long resolutionTime.
evidence: CSV: Ticket Created=2025-10-06 10:42:39
CSV: Ticket Closed=2025-10-21 13:35:58
CSV: resolutionTime=1043639
“Placing on hold for 12 hour(s)”
“Raymond has asked that we put the ticket on hold until his next shift…”

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: Agents repeatedly included an auto-closure warning (“stay open for one week unless…”) even while the customer was still actively reporting the issue within the same week. The ticket ultimately closed without any explicit customer confirmation of success in the provided thread, so closure may have been premature (uncertain because the final internal solve/close rationale is not shown).
evidence: “This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with "This ticket can be closed" or update the status to Completed…”
Customer still reporting after onboarding: “The customer reports still seeing the following error…” (2025-10-09)
CSV: Status=closed
CSV: Ticket Closed=2025-10-21 13:35:58

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: The requester marked the issue as urgent and it blocked device additions due to “0 licensed,” which is a high-impact scenario for an end customer. The handling included holds and routine browser-cache troubleshooting before the real root cause (email case sensitivity/automation bug) was identified, suggesting the urgency may not have been treated with consistent P1-style execution (some uncertainty: they did progress onboarding and ultimately deployed a fix).
evidence: Customer priority: “Button selection: [🔴 Urgent]”
Impact described: “The customer… is not able to add devices… as they have no active licenses.”
“Placing on hold for 12 hour(s)”
Routine step before identifying root cause: “clear cache and cookies, restart the browser…”
Root cause later found to be a defect: “issue was related to case sensitivity in the customer's email address during the automation process. This has now been resolved.”
